last_post.content: Check out this awesome 10 minute long tutorial created by Leo from MediaWay! https://youtu.be/l52V16kZubo

Someone finally did a study based on data from GitHub PRs that measures how it is that teams that do continuous code review (either #pairprogramming or #mobprogramming) are somewhat counterintuitively able to perform so much better than those doing asynchronous code reviews (pull requests). Lotsa queuing theory but it boils down to ensemble programmers having zero interruptions & remaining in a flow state. https://youtu.be/fYFruezJEDs

(Also the psychological safety advantage is huge in my XP ☺️)

title: Overwhelmed by Huge Wikipedia Categories? There's a Search Gizmo for that.

last_post.content:
Hey y'all, I love exploring #Wikipedia but I hate running into a giant category with LOTS of pages. Who knows where to start?

So I made Category Cheat Sheet, which reorganizes Wikipedia category pages by popularity and then gives you a summary for each of the top 20.

If you've got 58 seconds I'll show you how it works:

https://www.youtube.com/shorts/NX_AwNeri_E

title: Chokepoint Capitalism with Cory Doctorow - FACTUALLY Podcast

last_post.content: On this week's Factually, @pluralistic joined me to talk about Chokepoint Capitalism, and how creative workers can free ourselves from its clutches: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5txRrCrfTyY

Next was a fantastic discussion with @timnitGebru on #AI, #ethics, and more at the #StanfordGSB. Gebru is always a must watch, and this fiery discussion is no exception - eviscerating the overhyped LLM/generative AI bubble by clearly and concisely enumerating the issues with these approaches from a variety of perspectives. Highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mztnETK073o&t=36s (5/7) #LLMs #AIEthics
www.youtube.com/watch?v=74lngE-Ro4I

title: Dr. Rachel St.Clair, Florida Atlantic University, "Efficient Learning in AI" to Northwest AGI Forum

last_post.content:
@MattHodges
Rachel StClair did a talk to my meetup.... the main issue is that a lot of play is informational and there is no "pass" or "fail" as in you get a reward or penalty, necessarily. She mixes in this idea along with selection of features in ML which, roughly, she wants the features to be independent of the problem at hand. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5MjJ9DwBToY

I've been enjoying Ryan Baumann's "Woz A Day" series demoing another Apple 2 game each day. (Ryan also does a "Moof A Day" series demoing early Mac software.)

My favorite weird find so far is The Bilestoad, an early physics-abuse game which models axe combat in far, far too much detail.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mce6ZCkVI54&list=PLXVtlqgyC7v2ACowTpMXcMrLbfX1qdBHE&index=63

Something I bet I share with mere dozens of people: Nine years later, I'll occasionally encounter a song and think "Ooh, this would have made a great ShuffleComp entry prompt."

Happens most with lyrical descriptions of specific locations, paired with richly imperative verbs suggesting things one can try doing there.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MiaLIqHOsb8

#InteractiveFiction #Synthpop #Music

(More about ShuffleComp: https://www.ifwiki.org/ShuffleComp)

title: Terran 1: Launching The World’s First 3D Printed Rocket

last_post.content:
Relativity is planning to make history today by launching the first 3D-printed rocket and the first methane-powered rocket to (hopefully) make orbit. Terran 1 is a pretty impressive design, but this is going to be an experimental launch so who knows what may happen. The livestream for the appropriately-titled "Good Luck, Have Fun" mission is linked below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_YAlOGZM32U

#Relativity #Terran1 #Rocketry #Space #Launch #NewSpace #3DPrinting

Those of you who are familiar with The Physics Girl YouTube series featuring Dianna Cowern, might not know that she's been battling a scary rare case of Long COVID that triggered a serious condition called ME/CFS. She's been rushed to the ER twice in the last week, and the condition is now life-threatening. She just got married in 2022 and her new husband has become her primary caregiver. Dianna's BFF and fellow YouTube science communicator, Simone Giertz (who builds silly, complicated robots), has issued a plea for contributions to Dianna's Patreon. If you have enjoyed Dianna's videos in the past, please consider contributing. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vydgkCCXbTA

title: Mastodon client for the Apple IIc

last_post.content:
In other retro Mastodon client news...

@colin_mcmillen has created a Mastodon client for Apple II! It was developed and tested on an Apple IIc, and uses an external Raspberry Pi for stripping SSL, parsing JSON, and converting charsets. It's fully featured and even supports displaying images!

Video that showcases it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HtCq50Qqwo8

More info in his blog post (focusing on the proxy/API): https://www.colino.net/wordpress/archives/2023/02/07/accessing-the-internet-with-an-apple-c/

UPDATE: You can now download it from here: https://www.colino.net/wordpress/archives/2023/03/06/binary-release-of-mastodon-for-the-apple-c/

#RetroProgramming #RetroComputing #AppleII

external / internal is a two-part musical interface: a data-driven pump that drips Chinese calligraphy ink according to anti-Asian hate crime cases, and code that reads painted colors and transforms them into sound. Performing with the instrument is intimate, introspective, chaotic, and emotional—and as the black ink takes over the paper, it encourages a relinquishing of control and an acceptance. It is a story told through colors and sound

🎥 for the full performance: https://youtu.be/n2jbzoM7gpw

Quark's root beer analogy during "The Way of the Warrior" is one of the most famous dialogue scenes in all of DS9 and it only came to be, because the production crew needed a quick scene to fill some time.
It was supposed to be comedic, until Shimerman and Robinson got to act it out in a very different and intriguing kind of way. #StarTrek https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6VhSm6G7cVk
https://youtu.be/K0PAhPjieVg
Missed the news about #WayneShorter. RIP to a true legend. Too many hits to choose from but every few weeks this one gets stuck in my head https://youtu.be/VFPIB4rFPIA
With a hint of Providence, RI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wzr6pYLiBUE
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gbBBl9jjW0U
In case you're wondering who we just lost: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LgaIUqH0w6c&list=RDEMsuhTWEJkwBDmWszQRxgD8A

Amazon File Cache has taken Lustre mainstream (yes, we know that sounds weird). Lustre has been serving the #HPC community for a few decades now, and it's now a High Performance Caching layer for Amazon S3 and even on-prem NFS, giving them an instant boost. #AWS #HPC https://youtu.be/I1-Vxwgzlbk

Wayne Shorter and Esperanza Spalding, Footprints
https://youtu.be/QLVlpk46dP8
She brought flying monkeys. @jammer_volts talks javascript and product pages w/ @geekonaut https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=k2FDKHAbJvA&list=PLKoqnv2vTMUNaxNtrwmQAbYlm9Mj96R35

New Cypress.io video: "Map Input Elements Values" and check the values in a single assertion https://youtu.be/OmVzv6pJN6I PS: If you haven't subscribed to my Cypress videos - do it now, we are almost at 5k subscribers!

I'd just like to remind everyone that many of the bills banning trans healthcare in the United States will mean that hospitals and doctors in those states will no longer be able to simultaneously accept federal funding and follow the law.

Republican politicians admit this, but say "it's worth the cost" (raw link follows)

https://apnews.com/article/transgender-licenses-birth-certificates-4795c4380b25baa4c9a7a8ddddbca9b3

They are willing to make it so that the disabled and elderly in their state (Medicare and Medicaid recipients) cannot get healthcare. That their hospitals cannot get funding. Just to "protect the children" from policies that have existed for over ten years with no catastrophe that can be pointed to.

If you have an hour today, I highly suggest watching this (pre-coming out as trans) video from Abigail Thorn on antisemitism.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KAFbpWVO-ow

My mother's family "got out" between WWI and WWII. Understanding why antisemitism can help explain why other fascist targets. Why trans people?
Pianist Yuja Wang • Living the Classical Life Ep. 14 https://youtu.be/ZkH6jz1gy3Y via @YouTube
